text:
"Havana" is a song by Cuban American singer Camila Cabello, taken from her first solo album, "Camila". It is her best-charting lead single since leaving the music group Fifth Harmony. In the song, Cabello sings of her love for the city of Havana, Cuba, and her Cuban heritage. There is a rap by American rapper Young Thug in the song. The official remix features verses from Puerto Rican singer Daddy Yankee. The song has been a success worldwide, reaching the top two in Switzerland, Germany, Austria, France, Belgium, Denmark, and New Zealand, and number one in the United States, Australia, Canada, Spain, and the UK.
After spending seven weeks at number two on the US "Billboard" Hot 100, it was announced that the song reached the top for the week ending January 27, 2018. She became only the third artist in "Billboard" history to have both their first number-one song and album in the same week, after Beyoncé (2003) and Britney Spears (1999).
The song was certified sextuple platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America for sales and streams of six million copies in the United States.
